attributes.action: Public Consultation for the future of Billingham Town Centre
attributes.additional_details: To prevent Stockton Council conducting behind closed door meetings and not allowing members of the public to have any input
attributes.background:
To have a say on the future of their town centre
Form the £20m government levelling up funding, £6m from TVCA, and the the potential £15m from Stockton council

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about Billingham Town Centre are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Require Levelling Up Fund applicants to consult on plans: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/653331
